intro: Lachenalia martiniae, commonly known as the Martin's lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves. The plant produces tall, branched stems that bear clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and containers.
